article: Charlie Chaplin was the first international star of the modern era . He was especially beloved for his Little Tramp  _  . He was the first screen artist to write,  _  and perform in his own films; in fact,  in some cases  Charlie Chaplin even wrote the music for his movies. He was also the first artist to use his work to pass a  _  of equality and justice for all --  _  for the "little guy". Charlie Chaplin's career and life made  _  the first global icon ; his too-small hat, his too large shoes and his trademark moustache were instantly  _  by audiences from Chicago to China, from Iowa City to India. And they  _  are today. All of these make Charlie Chaplin the first citizen of our global village. Chaplin, a native of London, was born in  _  on April 16, 1889 to music hall performers. Chaplin only saw his  _  twice until the age of seven. The man  _  him and his mother about a year after Chaplin was  _  . During Chaplin's earliest years, his mother was a(n)  _  and performer. Then her voice gave out, her stage career  _  , and she began actively  _  Church of England services. At the age of  _  , Chaplin's mother was considered as the insane and sent to Cane Hill lunatic asylum , and the  _  sent Charlie and his brother to live with his father,  _  had by then stopped all payments of child support. Charlie Chaplin lived with his father only a short time  _  his mother was released from the lunatic asylum and then  picked up  Charlie and his brother, to live with her once again.
